benchmark_details.name: MEMTRACK
benchmark_details.overview: MEMTRACK is a benchmark designed to evaluate long-term memory and state tracking in multi-platform agent environments. It models realistic organizational workflows by integrating asynchronous events across multiple communication and productivity platforms such as Slack, Linear, and Git.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the memory capabilities of AI agents in dynamic environments and to promote research on multi-agent, multi-platform memory benchmarking.

data.source: Curated through manual expert-driven design and scalable agent-based synthesis.
data.annotation: Manual annotation and verification by in-house experts.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the accuracy of agent responses to the questions posed during evaluations.
methodology.interpretation: Performance is evaluated on the basis of how well agents can reason over task-relevant information across multiple platforms.
methodology.validation: Validated through experiments across state-of-the-art LLMs and memory backends.
